titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Pell, James H Husbands, Aaron Clard, Samuel Clancy, Preston Joy, Spencer Millikin, Lewis Pell, Benjamin Enochs, Calvin Freese, Alexander McCuan, Indictment
CWG5145

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Graves } SS.
Graves Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
James Pell James H Husbands Aaron Clard Samuel Clancy Preston Joy Spencer Millikin Lewis Pell Benjamin Enochs Calvin Freese Alexander McCuan.

The grand Jury of Graves County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse James Pell Jas H Husbands Aaron Clard Samuel Clancy Preston Joy Spencer Millikin Lewis Pell Benjamin Enochs Calvin Freese & Alexander McCuan of the crime of murder; Committed as follows: the said Pell, Husbands, Clard, Clancy, Joy, Millikin Pell Enoch Freese & McCuan, on the first day of November 1862 in the County aforesaid did feloniously and with Malice aforethught Kill & Murder James Connor by then & there shooting him with guns & Pistols loaded with a leaden bullett or other hard substance and by stabbing him with a bayonet or other sharp instrument, by reason of which said Shooting & stabbing said Conner lingered and died. Against the peace & dignity of the Comwealth of Kentucky.

P. D Yeiser
Commonwealth attorney 1st J. D

Information by C H Green C. J. Whittemore Myers Neil Calvin Thomas, E Anderson S E Sander J H Richards, Newton Prence Jas Beadles W G
Blount Wm Galloway & J. W. Stiverson

Endorsed "A true bill.
John Eaker foreman

Filed Decr. 4th 1862. & process issued Janury 19th 1863.
WA Turner cgcc
A Copy attest W A Turner c g c c

Comlth
vs } murder
Pell et al
(Copy)
